title: Understanding Robot Walking on Uneven Ground
content: This slide explains how robots like the Boston Dynamics Atlas walk on uneven ground. Scientists use math to plan the robot's steps, making sure it doesn't fall. They adjust the robot's center of mass and the forces at its feet to keep it stable.
key_points: Robots use math to walk safely on uneven ground.
The center of mass and foot forces are carefully calculated.
Scientists test these methods in simulations and real robots.
examples: Boston Dynamics Atlas robot in the DARPA Robotics Challenge.
Using math to plan steps and avoid falling.
